definition[0]: the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto something
example[0]: the imprint of her hand on the soft sand
definition[1]: the name of a publisher as it appears on a book
definition[2]: to print or press the mark of an object on something
example[1]: One snowy morning, footprints and tyre marks were imprinted in the snow.
definition[3]: to become fixed in your mind or memory so that you never forget
example[2]: The sight of Joeâ€™s dead body was imprinted on his mind forever.
note[2]: imprint something on your mind/memory/brain etc
definition[4]: the names of the PUBLISHER and the PRINTER as they appear on a book
example[3]: books published under the Books For Young Readersimprint
example[4]: Over the next three years, the imprint will publish between 300 and 400 books from its backlist.
